skills.name: Reflect an object or a point in a horizontal line with the line of reflection given as an equation, where the line of reflection lies on the edge or outside the object
Rotate an object or point 90° clockwise or anticlockwise about a point, where the point lies on the edge or outside of the object
Rotate an object or point 180° about a point, where the point lies on the edge or outside of the object
Translate a coordinate with a given vector where at least one value is negative

explanations.A: The top element of the vector represents moving 2 units right, so the x-coordinate becomes a + 2. The bottom element of the vector represents moving 3 units down, so the y-coordinate becomes b - 3. This gives us (a + 2, b - 3).
explanations.B: I think you have confused your vertical and horizontal movements. The top element of the vector tells us if we are moving left or right, so affects the x-coordinate.
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the parts of the coordinate by the elements of the vector. The elements in the vector tell us about movement left and right (top element) and up and down (bottom element). So here we are moving 2 right and 3 down.
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied the parts of the coordinate by the elements of the vector and confused your vertical and horizontal movements. The elements in the vector tell us about movement left and right (top element) and up and down (bottom element). So here we are moving 2 right and 3 down.

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the parts of the coordinate by the amount of movement needed. Translating will involve adding and subtracting. Adding for right and up, subtracting for left and down.
explanations.B: I think you have moved 3 right and 4 up, we want 3 left.
explanations.C: I think you have moved 3 left and 4 down, we want 4 up.
explanations.D: Moving 3 left affects the x-coordinate, so a becomes a - 3. Moving 4 up affects the y-coordinate, so b becomes b + 4. So our new coordinate is (a - 3, b+ 4).

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the parts of the coordinate by the amount of movement needed. Translating will involve adding and subtracting. Adding for right and up, subtracting for left and down.
explanations.B: I think you have moved 3 right and 2 up, we want 2 down.
explanations.C: I think you have moved 3 left and 2 up, we want 3 right and 2 down.
explanations.D: Moving 3 right affects the x-coordinate, so p becomes p + 3. Moving 2 down affects the y-coordinate, so q becomes q - 2. So our new coordinate is (p + 3, q - 2).
